title: Dividend Income in Retirement Planning
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dividend Income in Retirement Planning.

hook.text: A retiree's dividend portfolio grew its payouts 6% a yearâ€”outpacing inflation and raising her income each year.

buildup.text: Dividend income provides a natural inflation hedge when you hold companies that consistently raise payouts.

discovery.text: Unlike bonds with fixed coupons, dividend growth stocks increase your income stream as the cost of living rises.

twist.text: The 4% withdrawal rule sells assets. A dividend-based strategy keeps the principal intact and spends only income.

climax.text: Combining growing dividends with Social Security can create a rising income floor throughout retirement.

punchline.text: In retirement, income beats withdrawals. Dividends pay you without shrinking capital.

quiz.question: How do dividend growth stocks help retirees fight inflation?
options: Rising payouts outpace the increasing cost of living
